data.title: Fort Rock Facts: 3 Doors Down
data.meta_description: 3 Doors Down is a band who prides themselves on giving back
data.text:
Who: 3 Doors Down

Formed: 1996

From: Escatawpa, Mississippi

Hits known for: Kryptonite, When I'm Gone, Here Without You, It's Not My Time

Current album: Threat to Survival

Fort Rock concert time: 6 p.m May 1st Yellow Stage

Once: Sang Landing in London where Bob Seger provided the second verse and backup vocals

Fest Fact: Singer Brad Arnold wrote the hit Kryptonite while in math class during his high school years. Although Arnold writes most of the lyrics for their songs, the credits are listed as the entire band to keep from writing disputes. The band created "The Better Life Foundation" with the goal to give children a better life. The foundation was created in 2003 and also helped provide aid in 2005 to victims of Hurricane Katrina.

Fort Rock: April 30th and May 1 at JetBlue Park

Bands: April 30:Rob Zombie, Five Finger Death Punch; A Day to Remember; Megadeth; Lamb of God; Anthrax; Sevendust; Ghost; Issues; Saint Asonia; Avatar; The Glorious Sons

May 1:Disturbed; Shinedown; Bring Me The Horizon; 3 Doors Down; Sixx A.M.; Pennywise; Bullet for My Valentine; Pop Evil; Asking Alexandria; Trivium; Red Sun Rising
